name: Crispy-Skinned Orange Honey Salmon
author: Derek Lutz
summary: Fresh, Asian-inspired salmon fillets with a crispy skin and an orange, ginger, and honey glaze. Unlike most similar recipes, this one is made without soy sauce and with totally fresh ingredients. The result is a bright, fresh fish with great taste and texture. The fresh ingredients are the star here: Don't substitute with dried, powdered, or frozen ingredients! I served on top of rice and steamed broccoli garnished with green onions.
ingredients: ½ cup freshly squeezed orange juice
directions: Combine orange juice, honey, vinegar, olive oil, garlic, ginger, sesame seeds, salt, and pepper in a large resealable plastic bag
Seal and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours
Place a large cast iron skillet in the oven
Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Carefully remove skillet from oven when it just barely starts to smoke
Add vegetable oil and place salmon fillets, skin-side down, in the skillet
Bake in the hot oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, or to your desired doneness, 5 to 9 minutes
